text:
Not sure if Susan's question is being answered. since Win11 January 9th patch is
22621.3007 and 22631.3007, shouldn't that be a 3007, not a 3000? I've pinged a
half-dozen Win11(23H2, 22H2) folks with fully updated(through Jan 2024 updatew)
to confirm her reported Windows 11 version/build numbers and the DISM command
that retrieves the Service Pack Build Number In all cases post the Jan 9
patch(plus my own personal Win11 Pro 23H2) the results are the consistently the
same - Service Pack Build reports 3000, a lower number than the installed,
updated o/s version # 22621 or 22631 with build number 3007 or 3085 - the latter
3085 indicates the Jan 2024 Preview was installed. Winre.wim, on five devices(4
others plus my W11 Pro 23H2) upon inspection shows it was changed/modified on
Jan 9th. Thus, it appears the security patch was successfully installed *and*
winre.wim and its partition was updated(modified date and the size increase -
more partition used space, less free space) -=
Link: None

metadata.topic: Win11 22h2 and later - they don't need 250 free? Yes? No? and what about checking if you are patched? (aka I'm confused)
metadata.subject: RE: [patchmanagement] Win11 22h2 and later - they don't need 250 free? Yes? No? and what about checking if you are patched? (aka I'm confused)
